content: I’m certain the scholarly genus Meleagris would enlighten us with the opinion of Benjamin Franklin regarding the respectability of her species as the national bird over that of the Bald Eagle, which Franklin claimed in a letter to his daughter, did not come by its living honestly, but was rather lazy in preferring to steal fish from other more industrious birds. Whereas, the Turkey is a true native of America and besides being a little “vain and silly” he is a bird of courage and industry.
